data.title: Uncategorized Archives
data.text:
Ronald J. Kryman, Sr., 70, of Douglassville, PA passed away on Sunday, April 29, 2018, in his residence.

Born, in Batavia, NY, he was the son of the late Edwin F. and Agnes (Oberthin) Kryman. He was married to Carmen Ann (Trinchera) Kryman.

He worked as a Comptroller for the former Doehler Jarvis in Stowe, PA. Ronald was a member of the American Legion Post 0047 and also a member of Immaculate Conception BVM RC Church, Douglassville, PA. He was a veteran of the US Army and served in the Vietnam War.

Surviving Ronald, along with his wife Carmen, are 2 sons: Ronald J. Kryman, Jr. husband of Tara of Douglassville, PA, Peter J. Kryman, fiancé of Candace Feliciano of Birdsboro, PA; 1 daughter: Katie Davis, wife of Greg of Douglassville, PA; and 3 brothers: Edwin F. Kryman, Jr. of Fredonia, NY, Frederick J. Kryman of Ft. Wright, KY, and Daniel Kryman of Batavia, NY. He is also survived by 12 grandchildren.

Ronald was predeceased by 1 daughter: Jackie Lynn Kryman.

A visitation will take place on Sunday, May 6, 2018 from 4:00pm-6:00pm at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc., 144 N. Spruce St. Birdsboro, PA 19508. A Mass of Christian Burial will be held on Monday, May 7, 2018 at 10:00AM at Immaculate Conception BVM RC Church, 905 Chestnut St. Douglassville, (Union Twp.) PA 19518.

In Lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be sent to Immaculate Conception BVM RC Church at the above address.

ALBERT NICHOLAS “POP-POP” SUGLIA, age 85, of Birdsboro, PA went Home to be with our Lord on April 24, 2018 in the Reading Hospital. Albert was born 2/13/1933 in Reading, PA to the late Paul and Margaret Suglia.

He was the loving husband of Catherine (Janet) nee Wolf whom he shared 62 years of marriage. They were married on October 1, 1955.

Albert was a member of St Paul’s Lutheran Church in Amityville, PA.

He was President of Skyline Cruisers of Eastern PA. He was also the past President of the Amity Athletic Club where he coached football, baseball and basketball.

Albert graduated from Reading High School in 1953 and, shortly after, was drafted into the US Army. He did his basic training at Fort Indiantown Gap and served 18 months in Korea during the Korean War. Albert was a staff Sargent in the 2nd Infantry Division. After his military service, he worked at Firestone Tire and Rubber Co, retiring after 26 years. In addition, Albert worked at the Limerick Power Plant, Snow King, and W.E. Fasnacht Electrical Contractors.

Albert had a passion for cars, especially his 37 Ford street rod. He enjoyed attending Skyline Cruiser functions with all his street rod friends. Albert was proud to be one of Kenny Brightbill’s mechanics helping to lead the #19 “Haul Ass” to many victories at the Reading Fairgrounds.

Albert’s favorite pastimes were watching Nascar races (Kyle Busch was his favorite driver), and the Philadelphia Eagles, thankfully being with us long enough to see them win the Super Bowl this year.

Albert enjoyed “tinkering” with everything. There was nothing that he couldn’t fix – except his son!

Albert was known for his craving of peanut butter and jelly, his coffee and the need for Ketchup on almost everything.

There was nothing Albert loved more than his family.

He will be sadly missed by his children:

Sharen L. (the Smart One), wife of Scott Frasso, Brighton, MI

Donna L. (the Pain In The Ass Forgotten Middle Child), wife of Dennis E Hess, Boyertown, PA

Timothy A. (the Favorite Prodigal Son), significant other of Tracey McGowan (whom we all feel sorry for), Birdsboro, PA

And his Beloved dog Zena.

His Grandchildren:

Kim Frasso, Mackenzie (Mark) Keranen, Jackie Ray, Tom (Alyssa) Hardaker, Jen (Brett) Boone, Danielle (Jimmy) Reimert, Brittany Suglia, Maddy and Trevor McGowan.

And his Great-Grandchildren:

Koby, Maysen and Baiden Paul, McKenna and Evelynn Hardaker (lovingly called McKenica and Envelope by their Pop-Pop), Hannah and Ryker Boone, Sam and Chase Reimert

Granddogs:

Rocco, Addison, Lucy, Sophie, Eyeris, Aly and Bentley

Brothers and Sister:

He is predeceased by Tony, Pauline, Carmen and Johnny.

Nieces and Nephews:

Toni Lou, Michael (deceased), Jeff (deceased), Scott, Gary, Kerry (deceased), and Carmen Marie.

Funeral Services will be held St. Paul’s Lutheran Church, 548 Old Swede Road

Douglassville, PA on Monday, April 30, 2018 at 11:30 AM. The viewing will be from 9:30 to 11:30 AM at the church.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions can be made to:

Humane Society of Berks County, 1801 N. 11th Street, Reading, PA 19604

American Heart Association, https://www.heart.org/HEARTORG/

St Jude’s Children’s Hospital, 262 Danny Thomas Place, Memphis, TN 38105

American Cancer Society, Berks Unit, 498 Bellevue Ave., Reading, PA 19605

Until we meet again, We Love You Dad!

Norman W. Slonaker, 63 of Birdsboro, Amity Twp., PA, died on Friday, April 20, 2018, at Pottstown Hospital.

Born in West Chester, PA, he was the son of the late Robert H. and Laura J. (Ortlip) Slonaker. He was the husband of Bonnie J. (Griffin) Slonaker.

Norman was a member of the American Legion Post 626 in Birdsboro.

Surviving, along with his wife, Bonnie, are 1 daughter: Gwendolynne Slonaker of Birdsboro; 1 brother: Ronald H. Slonaker of Glenmoore, PA; 1 sister: Dorothy I. Dorn of Gap, PA. He is also survived by 2 grandchildren: Ashley L. McWilliams and Brett D. Carpenter and 1great grandchild: Adriana J. McWilliams.

He was predeceased by 1 brother: James F. Slonaker and 1 sister: Margaret J. Slonaker.

A Memorial service will be held on Tuesday, May 8, 2018 at 11:00 AM at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc. 144 N. Spruce St. Birdsboro, PA 19508.

Ruth E. (Fix) Maurer Zook, 85, of Crestwood, Exeter Twp., PA, passed away on Friday, April 20, 2018, at Berkshire Center. Born in Gibraltar, Robeson Twp., PA, she was the daughter of the late William Q. and Annie V. (Garman) Fix. She was the widow of Melvin Maurer and Donald Zook, Sr.

Ruth was CFO of Vanscoy, Maurer, & Bash in Lancaster, PA, retiring in 2010.

Ruth was a Philadelphia Sports aficionado, from basketball showdowns at the Palestra, to the 2018 Super Bowl Champion Eagles, Ruth loved all sports. From Bob Boone to Coach K, the legends of sports gave Ruth a passion for victory that was unparalleled by most. She was also an avid coin collector, most of her life.

Surviving Ruth are 2 sons: Mark A., husband of Patricia Maurer of Lancaster, PA and Donald A. husband of Anastasia Zook of Bethel, PA; and 3 daughters: Carol L. Maurer Helms, wife of Steven of Pennside, PA, Joy Y. Bortz of Seyfert, PA, and Robin M. Stump of Reiffton, PA. She is also survived by 15 grandchildren, 14 great grandchildren, and 1 great-great grandchild.

She was predeceased by 4 brothers: Herbert “Hob”, Robert, William, George “Smokey” Fix.

The funeral service will be held on Thursday, April 26, 2018 at 2:00pm at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc. 144 N. Spruce St. Birdsboro, PA 19508. A viewing will be held before the service at the funeral home from 1:05pm-2:00pm on Thursday.

Interment will be in St. John’s Cemetery, Gibraltar, PA.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to the Reading Hospital SICU, 420 S. 5th Ave., West Reading, PA 19611, or Good Shepherd Raker Center, 601 St. John’s St., Allentown, PA 18103 (Residents Activity Fund).

Richard D. Delp, 87 of Birdsboro, Exeter Twp., PA, died on Saturday, April 21 , 2018, at Exeter Greens Care and Rehab. Center. Born in Birdsboro, PA, he was the son of the late Warren W. Delp, Sr. and the late Margaret E. (Bryan). He was the widower of Shirley L. (Killian) Delp who passed on 3/22/2018.

Richard worked in the Line Dept. for Met-Ed in Reading, PA for 40 years and retired in 1992.

He was a member of St. Mark’s Lutheran Church, Birdsboro. Richard was a graduate of Birdsboro HS, Class of 1949 and was also a member of the Birdsboro HS Alumni. He enjoyed helping with the food bank in Reading, PA with member of his church for many years.

Surviving, Richard are 1 son: Richard D. Delp, Jr., husband of Margaret of Exeter Twp., PA; and 1 daughter: Deborah L., wife of Michael Spanier of Lakeland, FL; and 1 sister: Margaret Rubendall of Audobon, PA. He is also survived by 6 grandchildren and 15 great grandchildren.

He was predeceased by 1 brother: Warren W. Delp, Jr. and 1 sister: Dorothy Hoffman.

The funeral service will be held on Thursday, April 26, 2018 at 11:00 AM at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc. 144 N. Spruce St. Birdsboro, PA 19508. A viewing will be held an hour before the service at the funeral on Thursday.

Interment will be in Forest Hills Memorial Park, Reiffton, PA.

Inger M. (Henriksen) Harrison, 88, of Gilbertsville, PA passed away on Monday, April 16, 2018, at Pottstown Hospital. vBorn in Philadelphia, PA, she was the daughter of the late Herman H. and Ellen Elisabeth (With) Henriksen. She was the wife of William K. Harrison.

Inger worked as a Secretary for Ernst & Young in Philadelphia, PA. She was a lifelong member of East Falls Presbyterian Church in Philadelphia, where she served as Deacon. She was also a member of the Danish Sisterhood. Inger enjoyed cooking and traveling.

Surviving along with her husband William are 2 sons: Dr. Keith W. Harrison, husband of Marianne of Douglassville, PA and Eric P. Harrison of Gilbertsville, PA; and 2 grandchildren: Billy Harrison and Katie Sowers.

She was predeceased by her brother: Herman H. Henriksen.

A funeral service will be held at East Falls Presbyterian Church, 3800 Vaux St. Philadelphia, PA 19129 on Saturday, April 21, 2018 at 11:00AM. A viewing will be held at the church an hour before the service from 10:00-11:00AM. Burial will be private.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to East Falls Presbyterian Church at the above address.

Anna Borges (Mello) Twigley, 83 of Amity Twp., Berks Co., PA, formerly of Westerly, R.I., passed away peacefully on Friday, April 13, 2018, at Sacred Heart Villa in Reading, PA.

Born July 26, 1934 in Westerly, Rhode Island, she was the beloved daughter of the late Antone Mello and the late Mary (Medeiros) Mello. She was the widow of John L. Toscano and Robert E. Twigley.

She will be greatly missed by surviving son, William D. Toscano, and his wife Allison Hewett of Glens Falls, NY; daughter, Rosemary Toscano Wisniewski, and her husband John, of Douglassville, PA; grandchildren Brooks, Jack, Anna, Theresa, Nicole; and great grandchildren Abigail and Alexander.

She was predeceased by her brother, Edmund Mello, whom she loved dearly.

Anna was employed by the Westerly Hospital as Home Care Coordinator before retiring in 1995. Previously she worked as a registered nurse for the hospital and for the Visiting Nurses Association. Following retirement, she worked at Stop & Shop Grocery Store, Westerly, RI, and Redner’s Markets, Inc., Douglassville, PA.

As an active member of the Westerly community, Anna was a member and past president of the Westerly Nurses’ Club, a long-time member of Westerly Yacht Club, and a choir member at St. Pius X Church. While living in Douglassville, Anna was a member of Immaculate Conception RC Church, the church’s choir, the Inspiring Attituders Chapter of the Red Hat Society, and the Birdsboro Senior Center.

Anna was a 1952 graduate of Westerly Senior High School, and also graduated from the St. Joseph’s Hospital School of Nursing, Providence, RI.

The family will receive friends from 9:30 AM to 10:30 AM on Tuesday, April 17, 2018, at Immaculate Conception R C Church, 905 Chestnut Street, Douglassville (Union Twp.), PA with a Mass of Christian burial to follow at 10:30 AM.

The service in Rhode Island will be held at Buckler-Johnston Funeral Home, 121 Main Street, Westerly, RI on Saturday, April 21, 2018 at 11:00a.m.with a viewing from 9:00a.m. to 11:00a.m.

Interment will be in St. Sebastian Cemetery, Westerly, R.I.

Memorial contributions may be made to Sacred Heart Villa, 51 Seminary Ave. Reading, PA 19605, or St. Jude’s Children’s Research Hospital, 262 Danny Thomas Place, Memphis, TN 38105.

C. Scott Ludwig, Jr., 71 of Birdsboro, PA passed away on Friday, April 13, 2018, at his Residence in Amity Twp, Berks Co., PA after a year-long battle with lung cancer.

Born August 30, 1946 in Reading, PA, he was the son of the late Calvin Scott Ludwig, Sr. and the late Virginia (Kline) Ludwig. He was the husband of Roseann S. (Wheeler) Ludwig.

Scott retired in 2008 from Jacob Pattern Works, Stowe, PA.

He was a member of St. Paul’s UCC, Douglassville, PA and the Lil Brothers Car Club in Pottstown, PA.

Surviving along with his wife of 49 years, are son; Peter M. husband of Sarah Ludwig of Robeson Twp., Berks Co., PA, daughter; Karin L. wife of Gregory F. Dushaw of Alexandria, VA, brother; Stewart A. Ludwig of Amity Twp., PA; 3 grandchildren; Brett Ludwig, Collin Ludwig, and Ava Dushaw.

He was predeceased by daughter, Robyn Ann Ludwig.

Scott was known for his love of refurbishing classic cars. He also loved to work in his yard and tinker on projects in his garage and around the house. In more recent years, his grandchildren gave him great joy.

Private Services will be held at the convenience of the family and a Celebration of Life will be held at a later date.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to stjude.org St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, 262 Danny Thomas Place, Memphis, TN 38105 or berksarl.org Berks County Animal Rescue League, 58 Kennel Rd., Birdsboro, PA 19508.

Dengler Funeral Home, Inc., Birdsboro, PA, is in charge of the arrangements.

Barbara Ann (Wamsher) McCord, 84 of Cumru Twp., Berks Co., PA formerly of Birdsboro, passed away on Friday, April 6, 2018, at the Reading Hospital & Medical Center.

Born September 18, 1933 in Douglassville, PA she was the daughter of the late Clarence Wamsher and the late Thelma Ruth (Trace) Wamsher.

She was the widow of Lester Warren “Ernie” McCord.

Barbara was a member of St. Thomas Episcopal Church, Morgantown, PA. She was also a member of Birdsboro Rotary Club, Animal Rescue League, Berks County Sheriff’s Association, and the American Legion.

Surviving are son; Mark S. husband of Christine McCord of Boyertown, PA, 2 grandchildren; Jeremy husband of Jen McCord of Douglassville, PA, Justin husband of Maegan McCord of Exeter Twp., PA, 4 great-grandchildren; Lillian Rose McCord, Harper Evangaline McCord, Dylan Liam McCord, and Hailey Marie McCord.

She was predeceased by 3 brothers and 1 sister.

A viewing will be held at the Dengler Funeral Home, Inc., 144 North Spruce Street, Birdsboro, PA on Tuesday, April 10, 2018, from 9:30 to 11:00 AM, followed by a funeral service at 11:00AM.

Burial will be in Birdsboro Cemetery.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to St. Thomas Episcopal Church, 6251 Morgantown Rd, Morgantown, PA 19543.

Stephen A. Mammarella, 29, was killed in a bicycling accident near his home in Fort Myers, Florida, on March 31, 2018.

He was born on September 21, 1988 to his parents, Stephen C. Mammarella and his wife, Marcie L. (Davidheiser) Mammarella of Robeson Township.

Stephen was a 2007 graduate of Twin Valley High School and received his A.A.S. degree in Business Management from Reading Area Community College. He was employed by Winn-Dixie and Haney’s Café in Fort Myers, and by the Bonita Springs-Estero Elks Lodge. He was a member of Immaculate Conception Church, Douglassville, where he was an altar server as a teenager.

Steve (known to his family and childhood friends as “Stevie”) was an intelligent, funny, and caring person who was dearly loved by his family and friends. He lived and breathed sports, watching them at home with his family in Pennsylvania and attending games in Fort Myers. He was an avid drummer and loved classic rock. Steve also enjoyed kayaking and fishing with his family in Maryland. He loved “waking up to paradise” in southwest Florida and spent as much time as he could at the beautiful beaches there. Most importantly, Steve measured wealth not in material things, but in the rich relationships and experiences he cultivated throughout his brief but happy life.

In addition to his parents, Stephen is survived by his sister, Mia T. (Mammarella), wife of Nathan R. Miller of Mohnton. He is also survived by his grandmothers Winifred Davidheiser and Doris Mammarella, as well as by several aunts, uncles, and cousins. He is predeceased by his grandfathers Raymond Davidheiser and Henry Mammarella.

A Mass of Christian Burial will be held at Immaculate Conception Church, 905 Chestnut St., Douglassville, (Union Twp.), PA 19518 on Wednesday, April 11, 2018 at 10:30 a.m. The viewing will be held prior to the Mass from 8:30 am to 10:15 am.

Burial will be in Immaculate Conception Church Cemetery.

In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Immaculate Conception Church, at the address above.
